title: Shoulder Pressing
description: Begin in a low squat with your feet a little less than shoulder distance wide. Lift your bottom and bringing your hands in between your legs, place your hands on the floor behind your feet. Rest the backs of your thighs as high on your upper arms as possible. Carefully shift your bodyweight back so that your feet lift from the floor. Squeeze your arms with your legs. Hook one ankle over the other. Once you feel balanced, work toward straightening your arms. Balance in the pose and take slow, deep breaths. Bend your elbows and release your feet to the floor with an exhale. Bring thighs high on upper arms Shift body weight back to balance Modification: Keep your arms bent. Avoid this pose if you have wrist, arm or shoulder injury.
alignment_cues: Maintain steady breath throughout the pose
Keep proper alignment based on pose type
Listen to your body and modify as needed
